title: Go Yo-han
text:
Go Yo-han (; born 10 March 1988) is a South Korean <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="right-back">right-back</a> who plays for <a href="FC%20Seoul">FC Seoul</a>.
Club career.
In 2004, he dropped out of middle school after failing math class and joined <a href="FC%20Seoul">FC Seoul</a>.
In 2006, he made his professional league debut in <a href="Korean%20League%20Cup">League Cup</a>, after he made 3 appearances and 2 appearances respectively in <a href="K-League%202007">K-League 2007</a> and <a href="K-League%202008">K-League 2008</a>.
In 2009, he gained the opportunity to become a starting player after <a href="Lee%20Chung-Yong">Lee Chung-Yong</a> moved to <a href="Bolton%20Wanderers%20F.C.">Bolton Wanderers</a>.
International career.
On 5 October 2009, he was called up first <a href="South%20Korea%20national%20football%20team">South Korea national team</a> for friendly match against <a href="Senegal%20national%20football%20team">Senegal</a> of 14 October.
In May 2018 he was named in South Korea's preliminary 28 man <a href="South%20Korea%20national%20football%20team">squad</a> for the <a href="2018%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2018 FIFA World Cup</a> in Russia.
Honours.
Club.
FC Seoul
Personal life.
Unlike most Korean people, Go does not have a <a href="Hanja">Hanja</a> name. His given name, Yo-han, comes from the Korean translation of <a href="John%20the%20Apostle">John</a> (Korean: 요한), apostle of <a href="Jesus">Jesus</a>.
